page.title: 11Commuting from Billingshurst
page.content: Weekday mornings and evenings{(7am & {7pm)}see many people (particularly men) commute to the London rail terminii of{Victoria & London Bridge.} This is expensive{(Â£1000+ per annum)} and time consuming{(70 minutes).} London however holds out the prospect of jobs at above average earnings in the Head Offices of large, often multinational, companies particularly in the{insurance}and{banking}fields as well as jobs in{stockbroking}and the{ {'city'.}Commuting can become a whole way of life. Regular card schools grow up as well as friendships and an informal but 'understood' seating pattern.{Buffet Cars}become mobile pubs. High cameraderie exists especially in times of{rail strikes.} Spouses frequently drive people to the station to avoid parking problems and thus more social networks begin.
